channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Gen Z and young millennial employees are missing the equivalent of one day’s work every week due to mental health concerns, research shows
item.description: That's costing the British economy a staggering $176 billion.

item.title: Robinhood earnings disappoint Wall Street despite company’s upward trajectory
Martha Stewart hates the Netflix movie about her
item.description: The iconic TV personality criticizes the documentary “Martha” for spending too much time on her imprisonment

item.title: Microsoft and Alphabet’s latest earnings show once again that it’s all about the cloud
item.description: Microsoft's cloud helped to lift its fiscal first-quarter results after Google's parent reported similarly strong cloud growth a day earlier.

item.title: Microsoft beats Wall Street expectations with big help from its cloud business, but warns of slower growth in second quarter
item.description: CEO Satya Nadella attributed the faster-than-expected growth to artificial intelligence transforming the workplace.

item.title: Wall Street entering its best 6 months of the year. Why stocks have room to run.
Microsoft CEO says AI business on pace to clear $10B annual revenue run rate
MicroStrategy plans to raise more than $40 billion to buy more bitcoin
Mark Zuckerberg says a lot more AI generated content is coming to fill up your Facebook and Instagram feeds
item.description: First we had friends in our social media feeds, then we had influencers. The next natural phase of the evolution is a feed full of AI-created content,...

item.title: Microsoft sees growth slowdown for Azure cloud business in current quarter
